result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Earl Smith

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Cash Bond Adjusted down. Justice Point Supervision at Level 5  and all other conditions of bond remains in place.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Robert Earl Smith.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.
Bail Bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. 
Court GRANTED defense bail motion to modify bail for reasons placed on the record
Defense in receipt of the State's Offer and request time to discuss with defendant.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference on 9-29-2022
Court is in trial on a different matter and ordered case adjourned.
Parties advised of the new date via email. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling Conference scheduled October 13, 2022 at 2:30pm.

Defendant Robert E Smith not in court, in custody. 
Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Robert E Smith.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held discover and defense motion for a bail bond hearing and request adjournment.. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Defense Motion for Modification of Bail.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Robert Earl Smith in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Earl Smith appeared by video means.
Case in court for an arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court by video with Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens who appears in person.  Defendant Robert Earl Smith in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17JV61A. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Detective M. Keck. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with:
CF-P (involved in the investigation in Count 1).
AG (Victim in Counts 4 and 15).
GG (Victim in Counts 4 and 15).
JEL (Victim in Counts 8 and 17).
JM (Victim in Counts 6 and 16).
KO (registered owner of the Chevy Impala).
DJS (victim in Count 2).

No Contact/No Firearms Order; signed and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Robert Earl Smith in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
